body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.48-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exp **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjodsnijdsojso@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the transaction thread. 5. Click Report. 6. Click Remove from report. 7. Go to self DM. 8. Open the unreported expense. 9. Right click on "moved this expense to your personal space" system message. 10. Click Reply in thread. ## Expected Result: "moved this expense to your personal space" system message will not show HTML tags in thread header. ## Actual Result: "moved this expense to your personal space" system message shows HTML tags in thread header. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2effeea2-64fc-4f02-a0b4-548e80ea26a7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Update homescreen app shortcuts on iOS and Android

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Problem When long-pressing an app icon on Android and iOS, you are shown some specific app shortcuts. These icons and terminology isn't up to date, so let's update them. This is what it looks like today: - The icons are too big and wrong - The terminology is outdated ## Solution Let's update the following things to ensure they're correct: - `SmartScan` becomes `Scan receipt` - `Log distance` becomes `Track distance` - `Manually create` becomes `Create expense` All icons should also be updated: - [Camera icon](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/assets/images/camera.svg) - [Location icon](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/assets/images/location.svg) - [Expense icon](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/assets/images/receipt.svg) cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.47-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1880/folder/13176676/41236544/1002489875?p=2 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck117251@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch Hybrid app & sign in with gmail account 2. Create workspace >> More features >> enable tags 3. Navigate to Tags option 4. Add few tags 5. Tap More >> Import spreadsheet 6. Select either Single level of tags or Multi-level tags (upgrade to control WS) 7. Click "download a backup" link 8. Cancel the download (do not save CSV export) 9. Click Cancel (or Switch Tag Levels) 10. Try clicking either Multi-level tags, Single level tags or back button in import tags page ## Expected Result: App should not freeze on import tags page after cancelling tags download backup. User should able to go back to add tag page ## Actual Result: App freezes on import tags page when download backup is cancelled ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf0d28a1-5f25-4162-afe5-05f41aaff3d2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [Due for payment 2025-11-17] [$250] Expense - Negative expense can be submitted to user by changing To field on Confirm page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Awaiting Payment
labels.description: Auto-added when associated PR is deployed to production

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.47-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73354 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sojdnosjsodjosj1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Account has a workspace. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual. 3. Enter amount > Next. 4. On confirm page, click To field. 5. Select a user (not workspace). 6. On confirm page, click RHP back button. 7. On input page, add a negative sign to the amount. 8. Click Next. 9. Click Create expense. ## Expected Result: In Step 8, after changing the amount to negative, Confirm page should reset To field to the default workspace, because we are not allowed to submit negative expense to 1:1 user. ## Actual Result: In Step 8, after changing the amount to negative, Confirm page does not reset To field to the default workspace. As a result, the negative expense can be submitted to the user, but the submitted expense is not negative. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e7909c9f-8592-48af-b4b6-0fd37523754d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.46-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo12old.approver@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Pre-condition: Language set to French 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Login with a Gmail account 3. Navigate to Reports → Filters 4. Tap Date Filter → On 5. Note the date modal opens 6. Tap the arrow on the top right to view all months ## Expected Result: All month names should follow proper French capitalization: “Décembre” “Août” “Février” ## Actual Result: Some month names are displayed with incorrect capitalization: “DéCembre” (C incorrectly capitalized) “AoûT” (T incorrectly capitalized) “FéVrier” (V incorrectly capitalized) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.46-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1alefish@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: Pre-condition: Note: Issue is reproduced in all Languages. Bug is reproduced for French language for example. Set language to French 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Login with a new gmail account 3. Create a workspace 4. Go to reports - filters 5. In type section, note last option " workspace" is shown in English 6. Tap on workspace 7. Note header text workspace also displayed in English ## Expected Result: Both the option label and header should be translated to French as “Espace de travail.” ## Actual Result: When the app language is set to French, the last option under the “Type” section and its header are still displayed as “Workspace” in English. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e2fb2b51-a321-442b-b2c8-d66ed7ef5ea3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.46-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1859/folder/13176681/41236997/999691858 **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to any conversation or workspace chat 3. Type "@" in the compose box 4. Put finger at the first row of user suggestion list and slide down (slide down, not scroll the list) ## Expected Result: After slide down the suggestion list, user can scroll the page ## Actual Result: After slide down the suggestion list, user unable to scroll the page until close keyboard ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
